title: What is toxic about this? Other games I can understand, but this one confuses me.
body:
Mickey Knox: that fiora
Mickey Knox: was talon
Mickey Knox: the other day
Mickey Knox: the feeding one
Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10
Mickey Knox: and built hexdrinker at 35 minutes
Mickey Knox: Whjat
Mickey Knox: no
Mickey Knox: no
Mickey Knox: get fucked
Mickey Knox: as if the minions
Mickey Knox: just changed target
Mickey Knox: holy shit
Mickey Knox: I remember wqhen LB chains werent global
Mickey Knox: good days
Mickey Knox: Fuck riot are worthless
Mickey Knox: lmfao
Mickey Knox: youre stunned
Mickey Knox: and can still cast
Mickey Knox: not sure whyd youd try to 1v1 lucian
Mickey Knox: cause youre lane ganked me
Mickey Knox: all it needs
Mickey Knox: against an assassin
Mickey Knox: youve died more than me
Mickey Knox: I thought soulstealer was only good if you dont die
Mickey Knox: But I don't have soulstealer
Mickey Knox: :^)
Mickey Knox: lmao
Mickey Knox: brand doesnt need kills
Mickey Knox: LOL
Mickey Knox: COMING FROM YOU
Mickey Knox: we will see damage
Mickey Knox: at end of game
Mickey Knox: dead lucian
Mickey Knox: ayy lmao
Mickey Knox: ded lucian
Mickey Knox: sick inhibs
Mickey Knox: gg
Mickey Knox: ez


What was punish-worthy there? 3 swear words, not directed at anyone. I wasn't rude or offensive and there isn't any hate speech. Prime example of how butthurt players just report everyone on the enemy team and watch them get punished because your shitty automated system can't detect context.

replies.body:
Hey man, 
I appreciate you sharing a bit of your reform card here so others can learn from it.

**Here's where you messed up a bit:**
 
+ _"Mickey Knox: that fiora
Mickey Knox: was talon
Mickey Knox: the other day
Mickey Knox: the feeding one
Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10
Mickey Knox: and built hexdrinker at 35 minutes"_

 I don't know if **Fiora** was on the enemy team or yours, but either way this isn't acceptable behavior. You're essentially calling her a noob and shaming her publicly. It reminiscent of the toxic behavior you might find on **Reddit** and **4chan**.

 We don't harass players for mistakes. It promotes toxicity and brings a strong anti-team environment. That player could have been a friend of someone on your team.

This falls under being [Directly Offensive](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h1q1) category for reportable behavior.

+ _"Mickey Knox: not sure whyd youd try to 1v1 lucian
Mickey Knox: youve died more than me
Mickey Knox: I thought soulstealer was only good if you dont die"_

 Similarly to before, you're harassing another player for in-game decisions and item choices. 

 Also no, it's not _"constructive criticism"_. You've clearly phrased it in a condescending tone and haven't given any real advice on how to improve.

This falls under being [Directly Offensive](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h1q1) category for reportable behavior.

+ _"Mickey Knox: gg
Mickey Knox: ez"_

 **Riot Lyte** has highlighted this as something the community is against. The report system subsequently bans for this. You can see **Riot Lyte** talk about this a bit [here](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answers/132069455298).

Generally the rest was just quite a bit of trash talking. I don't know how the system processes that, but it's definitely not positively. You don't have to be a goody two shoes to not get reported. You just have to be within community standards.

I understand this may have seemed uncalled for or controlling due to the lack of strictly offensive language. Just remember though, it's the intention or underlying message that's offensive.

I hope this helps for the future.

Again you have just highlighted the level of shittery this new reform card has. It has no timestamps. It doesn't have what channel it was in. It doesn't have what the enemy has said. 

>""Mickey Knox: not sure whyd youd try to 1v1 lucian
Mickey Knox: youve died more than me
Mickey Knox: I thought soulstealer was only good if you dont die""

The first comment was at a team mate. Asking them why they tried to 1v1 the fed carry might prompt them to rethink their actions. There was nothing offensive about the way I asked it.

The second one was in response to someone saying I was feeding. How can I be feeding if they have more deaths? That was the response, but of course, Shitbot3000 can't detect context and makes everything seem so much worse.

The third one was to an enemy Lux who was shittalking after dying 3 times. It is harmless banter. If someone is offended by that then they really shouldn't be on the internet.


>"Mickey Knox: that fiora
Mickey Knox: was talon
Mickey Knox: the other day
Mickey Knox: the feeding one
Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10
Mickey Knox: and built hexdrinker at 35 minutes"

Was spoken by me, to my premade ally, in team chat. There is no way they could have seen it and been offended, so they can't have reported me based on that.



and my god, if GG EZ in game filled with banter is reportable, riot needs to get hteir priroties straight

> Again you have just highlighted the level of shittery this new reform card has. It has no timestamps. It doesn't have what channel it was in. It doesn't have what the enemy has said.

This would actually be a great addition to the player reform system. When someone from the player behavior team does a Q&A, I'll point this out to them. Although, if you're feeling bold you can ask **Riot Lyte** yourself [here](https://twitter.com/riotlyte?lang=en) and [here](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/).

> The third one was to an enemy Lux who was shittalking after dying 3 times. It is harmless banter. If someone is offended by that then they really shouldn't be on the internet.

If someone is offended by it, then by definition it's not harmless. 

+ **Riot** loves banter among friends, but when you include strangers and others, you can't expect them to understand the context. Therefore just like in real life, you need to be more careful. 

 _Think about it this way:_
If one of your friends wears something weird to work or school, the all the lads are going to give him shit for it. That's just banter, because he understands the context.

 If you see a stranger dressed awkwardly and you give him shit, it's harassment. He doesn't understand the context at all. To him, you seem like an asshole.

 **Context is everything.** 
Although to be honest, I doubt you were banned for this or most of the other stuff for that matter. What would have actually triggered the ban is **Fiora** incident.

> Was spoken by me, to my premade ally, in team chat. There is no way they could have seen it and been offended, so they can't have reported me based on that.

+ If I say _"jews are terrible at league, they fed so hard in my last game lol noobs"_, it's not reportable unless someone who sees it is Jewish right?

 **Of course not.**

 One of the players who saw your post may have been a friend of that player, and taken direct offense, but either way it doesn't matter. The community is not willing to tolerate people walking all over each other and trash talking.

 You chose to express your opinion about **Fiora** in a public environment where there were 3 other strangers.  Someone saw this and rightfully thought that it was not behavior he wanted to see in League.

 You could have private messaged your friend with the in-game chat system, but since you decided to post this in a public environment, you are subject to the rules and standards we have.

I understand that the in-game report system can feel PC culture-ish at times, but it's really just protecting values that the players treasure and want to keep. If you want to play League you'll have to learn to fit in.

If you have any further questions feel free to reply, I'd be happy to help.

OR what is more likely to have happened is 

Enemy team happy to shit talk and banter while ahead, when we come back they get butthurt and decide to report everyone on the enemy team out of spite, because one of them is bound to have done something wrong.

It's definitely likely something similar to this happened, considering that for most of the match you just trash talked the enemy team. I wouldn't be surprised if a large amount of the enemy team reported you. I think most of us here don't exactly see that as exemplary behavior. 

Either way, if you did something wrong and the system called you out for it. Is that really a problem with the system? Or is it your own fault?

But if everyone if is talking shit in a game, no one would actually be getting offended.
It's like the KKK taking offense to something a neo-nazi says.

The best feature of the tribunal system was that if everyone in the game is screwing around, an individual player was **less likely ** to be punished because the "jury" was able to see that there was nothing serious happening, and it was just a little bit of banter and a reporting player got frustrated with the outcome of the game.

The automated system punishes toxic players faster which is ideal, but from the many cases I have seen, there seems to be a lot of collateral damage, and not Graves'.

I am more than happy to accept the punishment for the original game, but I just wasn't sure what was wrong with the second. It just seems to be a series of minor infractions, which should be the least of Riot's priorities.

It is like the police force saying "We have punished 30% more criminals this month", when that 30% were just kids caught littering. 

Like I said, I deserved the ban, in my opinion I should probably have my chat disabled permanently, but there are some people who would have similar reform card to that particular game and get punished for it. Their crime does not fit the punishment, especially when the reform card doesn't highlight what parts are the violations.

Just to add to what Tele has said, you mention 'the original game', so I'm assuming there was another log attached to the reform card? You're right in that things could be a lot clearer, sorry if I came off a bit antagonistic before. 

To the best of my understanding, any game that is flagged (a flagged game being a true report, a flagged game won't necessarily get you a punishment) within the..I guess punishment period we'll call it, will show up on the reform card. That game alone should not net you a punishment (if that is the case I would definitely appeal it). So basically what it seems has happened is you've had a series of flagged games, at least one of which was deemed punishment worthy. Does that make sense?

As Tele said, the tribunal is on it's way, and from the hints Riot have given it looks like it's going to be a much stronger system for sure.
Yeah that makes perfect sense, cheers for that.

Good news! The tribunal is scheduled for a release sometime during 2016. We should expect an announcement regarding it soon I'd imagine. **Riot Lyte** talks more about this [here](https://ask.fm/RiotLyte/answers/133246162370).

No judicial system is perfect including ours. We understand that sometimes the automated system can misunderstand context in some cases. I don't believe that is the case here however.

Anyhow, we're glad that you understand and accept why you were punished. Hopefully now you can focus on improving and helping others reform as well.

I hope to see you moderating with me when the tribunal comes out ;)

> [{quoted}](name=Telecasterdude,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2jJsM5p2,comment-id=0004000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-04-07T11:24:30.784+0000)
>
> Good news! The tribunal is scheduled for a release sometime during 2016. We should expect an announcement regarding it soon I'd imagine. 

That is good news. Let's hope its moderated by humans and not robots.

> [{quoted}](name=Telecasterdude,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2jJsM5p2,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-04-07T07:13:48.814+0000)

> **Here's where you messed up a bit:**
>  
> + _"Mickey Knox: that fiora
> Mickey Knox: was talon
> Mickey Knox: the other day
> Mickey Knox: the feeding one
> Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10
> Mickey Knox: and built hexdrinker at 35 minutes"_
> 
>  I don't know if **Fiora** was on the enemy team or yours, but either way this isn't acceptable behavior. You're essentially calling her a noob and shaming her publicly. It reminiscent of the toxic behavior you might find on **Reddit** and **4chan**.
> 

That's so weak. He's telling his teammates that the opponent is a feeder that doesn't know how to build a defensive item in time.

> This falls under being [Directly Offensive](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player#h1q1) category for reportable behavior.
> 
> + _"Mickey Knox: not sure whyd youd try to 1v1 lucian
> Mickey Knox: youve died more than me
> Mickey Knox: I thought soulstealer was only good if you dont die"_
> 
>  Similarly to before, you're harassing another player for in-game decisions and item choices. 
> 
>  Also no, it's not _"constructive criticism"_. You've clearly phrased it in a condescending tone and haven't given any real advice on how to improve.

He's suggested not to 1 on 1 a Lucian that is stronger. He could have said it in a sharp tone like "why the fuck are you trying to 1 on 1 Lucian, he's fed and you aren't!", or "Stop going alone, you're feeding!". Again so weak. If this is toxicity, then you should see the people in my games, its 100X worse than this.

I was also spectating a game played the other night where basically nearly everyone in the game ganged up to harass an adc, and said this harassment in ALL Chat. How do we report such people? You might like to check the logs of the game:

[http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/128601747/200724330?tab=overview](http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/128601747/200724330?tab=overview)

Absolutely atrocious behaviour. Think that player hasn't had a game since, after being picked on so badly.

> [{quoted}](name=PotatoFaps,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=2jJsM5p2,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-07T06:40:49.981+0000)
>
> They don't like being called worthless :^)

Yeah, you're probably right that this is the real reason.
There is absolutely no reason to say "ez" after you win a game. It's like spitting in someone's face after you beat them.
Its the act of a tool,  no question.  But a red card offense?

I don't think it deserves a perma ban or not able to play for awhile ban, but I do believe in a chat ban or something as a more awareness thing like "Oh, I've been chat banned for saying "ez" a lot, maybe I shouldn't do that any more." and most of the time people who say it are people who need looking into, the chat stuff above is an example. If they are saying "ez", then there could be worse things they are saying too and if it's pretty severe stuff, then yeah a ban for that's fine if chat bans and all that aren't working.
Yeah chat bans are fine.  If someone is being a bit of a dick in chat then a chat ban is fine.  But perma bans should be last resort

its pre-game banter. I personally dont see what the big deal is about this sort of stuff. It is in every game out there.

Personally I think riot are going a little over-board. Toxicity needs to be dealt with but I'd be focusing on serious issues (threats, racism, homophobia and play behavior like feeding / trolling) rather than a bit of swearing. Anyone is free to call me a cnt but I do appreciate there are lines that should not be crossed (eg the other day a player said he hoped my child fell down some stairs and died - this crossed a line and I was very pissed off).

Australia has the largest contributing population of the OCE server, and the fact that we swear more than other nations is well known [and the subject of academic study](http://www.smh.com.au/national/you-can-swear-by-australia-famous-for-foul-mouths-we-take-our-q-from-overseas-20090815-elsb.html). For this reason alone, a blanket application of a US-based global system cannot work to its full potential when the US and Australia are seen as being on opposite ends of the swearing spectrum - where in the USA saying "damn" is kinda rude, but in Australia the first word out of 90%* of children is "f$ck"

I reckon riot is getting a bit precious on the swearing front in a bid to look like they're taking action, but is the system used in oz a mirror of the system used in the USA and, if so, is it unnecessarily harsh on Australians for whom swearing is pretty much part of day to day interaction? I mean we're the country who calls our mates cnts and our enemies mate - I just question whether the system is perhaps unfairly discriminating against Australians due to cultural / linguistic differences when it comes to swearing?

(this is a serious post and a serious question, I am not taking the mickey)





*not a real statistic.

"the fuck was like 2/10"
"get fucked"
"holy shit"
"Fuck riot are worthless"
more than 3 and 3 of them were directed directly at someone.

> "the fuck was like 2/10"

This was spoken from me, to my premade ally, in team chat, about an enemy.
They can't have seen it, so they can't be offended or hurt by it, thus cannot report me based on that line.

>"get fucked"

Everyone says that when they don't expect something 

"Get fucked that's just my luck"


Riot has said multiple times they have no issue with swear words. Evidently fucking not.
people say "fuck that", "Get fucked" is you insulting someone because they died, or they said something you dont agree with

Except that wasn't the case. If the reform cards weren't half assed by Riot Lyte, they might be more useful.

I said it after LeBlanc and I fought, and just as she hit 5 health all my minions turned around to attack a siege minion instead of finishing the bitch off. It wasn't said out of anger or for any malicious reason.

Sick of dealing with the same bullshit every game? I've got the solution for you! All you have to is enter a game, and, press /mute all. That's it! No more hearing bullshit from your team or the enemy team!

~~I'll keep it simple ey, there is some punish worthy here.~~
 
~~Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10~~

~~This is just needlessly negative, so they had a bad game? Who cares. Doesn't matter if they're on the enemy team or not, and all you've done is set yourself in a negative light. The only interaction your team has had with you so far is you calling someone who had a bad game a feeder.~~

~~Mickey Knox: I remember wqhen LB chains werent global~~
~~Mickey Knox: good days~~
~~Mickey Knox: Fuck riot are worthless~~

~~Again just needlessly negative, and the fact that you are blaming the mechanics of the game for a death doesn't give people the best impression of you.~~

~~Mickey Knox: youve died more than me~~

~~So what?~~

~~Mickey Knox: LOL~~
~~Mickey Knox: COMING FROM YOU~~

~~Targeted negativity, doesn't do you any favours, minor or no.~~

___

I feel Telecaster explained all that better than I did so I'd recommend reading his post, but the rest is still relevant. Seems we were working ont he same post.

I'll let Tele take over from here.

___

> Prime example of how butthurt players just report everyone on the enemy team and watch them get punished because your shitty automated system can't detect context.

Not exactly giving us here the best impression either. I highly doubt you were punished for ONLY this game, and true enough it was minor, but you aren't exactly winning us over by demonstrating negativity here. False reports won't be actioned. 

This isn't a false report, but a minor case certainly. But with just the chat logs we are missing a lot of information that the system may have. Like were there other logs that contributed to a punishment? (I would think that more than likely). Was there reported in game behaviour that we are unaware of? What about pre and post game lobbies?

If you give us your whole reform card I can give you a bit more insight as to why you were punished.

>"Mickey Knox: the fuck was like 2/10"

This was spoken from me, to my premade ally, in team chat, about an enemy.

>"Mickey Knox: youve died more than me"

They said I was feeding, them dying more means theyre feeding just as hard. I was just showing them their arguement is void.

>Mickey Knox: I remember wqhen LB chains werent global
>Mickey Knox: good days
>Mickey Knox: Fuck riot are worthless

Again, this new reform card bullshit doesn't show context or the delay between messages. There was about five minutes between them and it was in response to someone else, in a different chat channel.

>Mickey Knox: LOL
>Mickey Knox: COMING FROM YOU

Targeted? Can't banter with enemy players cause negativity.



If this is seriously deemed toxic then riot should release a new line of "Wiggles" and "Teletubby" skins, because they are obviously aiming their game towards five year olds.
I feel Telecaster explained it better, I've edited my post and I'm letting him take over from here. I'll still be around if you have any direct questions.

This must have been posted while I was typing mine XD

Sorry about that, maybe you might learn something from mine as well. I've posted a few extra links you might want to check out.

My bad with the double post.
They don't like being called worthless :^)
